articles.description: Reaction to Monday's Premier League and FA Cup matches, plus build-up to more fifth round ties.
articles.title: Premier League and FA Cup reaction

articles.description: Sweden international and former Arsenal midfielder Kristoffer Olsson is on a ventilator in hospital after losing consciousness at his home on 20 February.
articles.title: Sweden midfielder Olsson on ventilator in hospital

articles.description: Max Verstappen, Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso are set to define the 2024 F1 season, but there is plenty of interest elsewhere, writes Andrew Benson.
articles.title: F1 2024: Max Verstappen, Lewis Hamilton & Fernando Alonso to define new season

articles.description: England should not be too disappointed despite defeat by India in Ranchi condemning Ben Stokes to his first series loss as captain, writes Jonathan Agnew.
articles.title: 'All not lost for England - Bashir looks the real deal'

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Jack Grealish will return to his starting line-up on a regular basis when his performances improve.
articles.title: Grealish must improve to return to side - Guardiola

articles.description: Britain's Josh Kerr is targeting world indoor gold in Glasgow this weekend as he prepares for the Paris 2024 Olympics.
articles.title: World Indoor Championships: Josh Kerr targets Glasgow gold before Paris 2024 Olympics

articles.description: Jarrod Bowen scored his first career hat-trick in West Ham's win over Brentford - is he now on course to make England's Euro 2024 squad?
articles.title: 'Unplayable' Bowen will be 'in Southgate's mind'

articles.description: Everton's 10-point deduction for breaching Premier League financial rules is reduced to six points on appeal.
articles.title: Everton punishment reduced to six points

articles.description: New Zealand pace bowler Neil Wagner, who took 260 Test wickets, retires from international cricket.
articles.title: 'It’s not easy to step away' - Wagner retires

articles.description: Great Britain's Andy Murray suggests he may only have a "few months" left of his tennis career after earning his second win of 2024 in Dubai.
articles.title: Andy Murray: Briton suggests he may only have few months left of career
